website_summaries.verdict: While you'll need a friend or two to help you erect this tent, it is an overall superior option that is most noted for its versatility.
pros: A great looking and very roomy tent
Can be used in any number of ways, from a carport or camping shelter to a party tent or storage
cons: Setup and break down are a bit complex, with many parts and heavy lifting involved
Make sure this tent is well-supported, or it will do poorly in the wind

customer_reviews.title: Practical tent
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This is a very long tent and very roomy. We are using as a way to keep the hordes of plants in planters safe from the feels like 17° weather. Also using a propane heater to keep the plants warm. Working very well. I recommend this tent due to various uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT STURDY
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product based on the reviews. Reviewers reported on its sturdiness- made of strong, quality steel, held up under 7 feet of snow and 50-mile-an-hour winds. I had it up for less than a month. The first wind we had- gusts of up to 25mph- the velcro wrap-around pieces tore away from the sides. I duct taped those and fortified the structure with tie-downs and stakes. Then we got 5 inches of snow. When I walked outside in the morning, the structure was crumpled on top of my son's car. The metal beams crushed and bent like an aluminum can. This product is crap. I now have $250 worth of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Beautiful and strong!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent almost 3 years ago and it has been out in some pretty nasty weather and held strong. It has withstood heavy rain, about 3 inches of snow, and winds of over 35 mph with proper anchoring. It is also a nice looking tent that can be used for parties or just park a vehicle or to store stuff in. I would definitely buy this tent again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage. I just put this up a week ago for my animals for the winter. we had some wind a few nights ago & it immediately bent my poles & bowed them. The tarp is so flimsy that it started fraying from the wind & it just shredded it into a hole. It’s useless now. I’m so disappointed. I wasted so much money on this. 🥺
customer_reviews.author: ppl

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble/disassemble
customer_reviews.text: Well it stood up to some strong wind storms. The problem is there are too many parts. Most car ports have two sizes of poles. This one has multiple sizes that are both male and female so setup is difficult especially if you don't have the instructions. Tear down was also difficult trying to separate all the poles.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: more of a single-use item
customer_reviews.text: This product is difficult to assemble. We had to reinforce a lot of the joints with gorilla tape to get things to stay together. Metal poles started showing rust almost immediately. We secured the top tarp section to the base, but the top blew off in the first strong wind. We gave up and didn't try the side sections. I'm giving this entire monstrosity away.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bierwirth

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money....
customer_reviews.text: So we bought the car port... and it has fallen over 2 times, thankfully the first time the car wasnt under it, the second time which just a little wind, has fallen over, and we also had cinder blocks also holding down, but that didnt even matter.... so now my car has scratches on it... and the tent is ripped... and I have o ly had it for about 3 weeks... the cheaper and useless thing ever. Not happy with it at all... mind you it was for my 66 mustang.... that now is going to need a paint job....
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a portable garage for my husband to work on his truck. His Ford F150 fits in it with room to spare. I boutgh the 10 X 20. I did, according to reviews I read, buy heavier duty tie downs stakes and I am glad I did. We live in the northeast and have had a few severe wind storms and very heavy rains and it is still standing. We have not had any significant snow yet but I think we would occasionally go out and push snow off the roof so it would not cave in. It being white with big windows it is very bright inside making working In it great to see.
customer_reviews.author: deedeefox

customer_reviews.title: Top cover is too small for frame.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I cancelled this order after finding a better one for less money from another company. Even though it was listed as cancelled, it was sent anyway. It arrived promptly and damage free. The top/roof cover is 4 inches too short to cover the frame so rain gets in. Some of the grommets already are pulling loose just in the setup with no wind or excessive force. I’ll make do with it. I’ll take pictures tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: DavoAK

customer_reviews.title: Does not like wind
customer_reviews.text: One lil wind storm which we rarely get and was tied and bolted down
customer_reviews.author: tammy Heilmann

customer_reviews.title: Vary good quality tent, and exceptional customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to rebuild my jeep with and it’s worked out very well, it broke a couple pipes early in the timeframe of having it because of wind, but they were real quick at replacing the parts that were broke, then eight months later we had a really bad wind storm and it took out a bunch of polls and a panel, and they were real generous and replace those also. I have to give them a A+ for their service department because they’ve been very good to me. The tent is vary sturdy and well worth the money paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Anders

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Tent does not include carrying bags, but they do also sell bag sets in different configurations separately. I contacted them about which bag set to use, and was told they haven't made a set for this tent yet. However, the three smallest bags of set 3 work great. You just leave the poles assembled. When I asked if I could order those bags specifically, they offered to send me set 3 for free..... Awesome! Easy to setup, but as mentioned in other reviews, I wrapped every junction with white duct tape. And I replaced the cheap stakes, with the Coleman stakes I use for all my other camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: GrizzlyT

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what we did wrong or if we received wrong cover?
customer_reviews.text: Not really a review because we can't get past the assembly, which is easy. But the tent cover comes off the ground about a foot all around. Not sure what we're doing wrong of anyone can help. We have the 10x20x9.1 See pics. Also posted under community question. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: aha

customer_reviews.title: Medium quality product  Great customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Some quality issues. Seller made it 100% right to my satisfaction. Great customer service!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthem

customer_reviews.title: Great Canopy
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I just had to for this one! We bought this canopy for a camp we took our youth to. We had some tubing issues and needed them quickly before the camp, contacted the company and within a couple of days had the replacement tubes. They were so nice and understanding! And at no added cost! This canopy has withstood not one but TWO camps (one a whole week!), winds, rain, and sun. It's very easy to set up, the tubes are numbered so you know what connects together. It's still in great condition. I'm sure it will last a long time. Overall great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It says it is heavy-duty however the tubing diameter is smaller than all others that I've used. Several of the grommets started to pull loose from the tarps upon being installed. The side posts did not lock into the main structure. After a VERY mild winter in Nebraska, the side tarps had several tears that looked like they cracked from being brittle. I could have purchased this for $89 from Amazon however I wanted something HD and paid $250 for this piece of junk that had less than 3 months on it. I want my money BACK!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great party tent, not recommended in windy conditions.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful temporary party tent, unfortunately it will not hold up in windy conditions with the included anchors, you may want to consider purchasing augers and better ropes to hold this baby down. It’s a great looking tent and excellent for parties. The customer service is top of the line, I’ve had to replace the poles one time and the entire unit the second, all were replaced free of charge, as it was still under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. CURCIO

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set up a few months ago and it has already been blown down and broken. The tie down ropes snapped as soon as I anchored them into the ground and the medal stakes that they provided to anchor the tent down wouldn't hold into the ground. I wasted my money because no its broken. If you plan to use this for anything other then a short term party do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: joseph schettler

customer_reviews.title: Stands strong even in bad weather
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. It can be completely assembled by a single person (it took me 3 hours) but would go much easier and faster with two people. The instructions state not to leave it up year round but I’m using mine as a car port. It has been through snow, rain, and very heavy wind. Have not had any issues with it wanting to come up from the ground. I did not use the stakes that were included. I purchased some 3/8 diameter 12” length galvanized barn nails from Lowe’s to tie the tent to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Rikka L.

customer_reviews.title: Will not withstand the weather
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent for our campsite for rainy weather and storage. It didn't last 6 months. The tarp has holes and the framing bent
customer_reviews.author: C Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Put it up myself in 1 hour. Was initially missing a few section of the frame but contacted the seller and they sent the parts out quickly. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Wholes where not right
customer_reviews.text: We got this product it had bent bars the eyes are not well set and we had to reem out all the holes so the lockes would pop out not very pleased at all
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Stone

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough but won't last long periods of weather.
customer_reviews.text: Used a ton of bungee loops to attach the cover to frame, and 2 were missing and this seems to be a common issue. Otherwise worth the money. Tie down pegs are a waist of time though. Tying off to a solid object and big pegs will make sure it stays in place in windy conditions. Velcro straps to stop sides flapping tear off easily in winds, but doesn't otherwise affect use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service - vendor that stands behind its product
customer_reviews.text: Given the size, canvas quality and that it includes side walls with windows, this is a great value. I use it for bbq competitions primarily. I will say that the wind did get ahold of it and bent a few poles. However, I contacted customers service via Amazon and the seller quickly sent me replacements at no cost. For this reason, I give the product/vendor 5 stars! Only suggestion would be slightly heavier gauge poles to have better resistance to wind. Again, good product value and great customer service. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service assistance and product value
customer_reviews.text: The car port was simple to understand how to assemble, and definitely a good value for what you get. Be sure to have the window sections face the correct direction & on the correct side of pole. Customer service was fantastic (thanks to their rep Jasmine). I didn't secure the car port well enough, and during a very heavy wind storm, some of the poles were damaged (would have happened to any car port purchased). I emailed them, and they didn't blink an eye to send me replacement parts in about a week ... no charge, and didn't have to send back the bent parts.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D Goettel

customer_reviews.title: Know your use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble with help. The side are short so water blows in. If you are going to leave it up for a long period of time, use a hammer drill to bolt it down. Not good for harsh weather. We had some bad weather and it got damaged. I asked to buy new legs but they sent me a whole new tent! That was great. It is an excellent temporary shelter! If you have mild weather you could leave it up longer. I appreciate that they replaced the whole tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jen T

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a party tent
customer_reviews.text: I searched a lot of party tent options, and I found this was a good value. It’s not heavy duty, so you can’t leave up longer than needed, but it fits together well, and looks very nice. If you take care when putting up and taking down, and secure when in place, I think you can get a lot of use from this product. Service was also excellent. I had one piece damaged in shipping and the response was very fast. Much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Steven T Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Re-considering my first review!
customer_reviews.text: I am adjusting my review to a 3 star because I thought the carport was good; but, not as sturdy as I expected. The seller was absolutely understanding with my return and with no questions asked, he refunded my account, that alone counts for a lot to me!
customer_reviews.author: Enid Cubero

customer_reviews.title: bent
customer_reviews.text: the tent was easy to set up but did not withstand the sudden wind storm we had and bent alot of the poles. its not very "heavy duty" as they advertise, but it gets the job done, we tacked it down with more string afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Saige

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent company! A month and a half after receiving I noticed a rip in one of the panels, contacted the company and they shipped 2 new panels out . I had them in 2 days. Great customer service. I Was able to set up in under an hour. Quality seems good and it looks awesome. The only thing I would suggest are bigger stakes to secure the ropes. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: steve vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: First wind storm and it went down. My husband got stronger tie downs and used them. Now, just waiting on the next storm to see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Kimberly G

customer_reviews.title: Wind blowed
customer_reviews.text: Well what can I say .....open the box and noticed the side wall Windows at folded Seams had stressed tears on 3out of the 6 Windows .....can't figure out how was that even possible ..just out of box ... unfolded..canopy top in great condition and sturdy...frame is exceptional for price and strength....well the first real windy day side Windows tore and blew out at those areas .....if u live in a windy area don't waist the money on side panels ....hope my panels was the exception not the rule.....Will contact customer service ...will wait and see what happens....
customer_reviews.author: Donna A DeAngelis

customer_reviews.title: Quality and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have used this carport for 3 years and have been very pleased with it. The frame has held up well and I am just now replacing the covers due to a couple of holes which were actually made by me. In seeking a replacement, your customer service did an excellent job to help me purchase a replacement canopy. I received it yesterday and will install it soon. It has been an excellent buy for my use. And, I couldn't have received better customer service when I inquired about replacement. Here's to another several years of using this carport.
customer_reviews.author: SLY

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I use this product as a car port and it does it's job, it's perfect for auto protection. The price was fair, I got what I expected. However, high winds tore the windows and caused some tearing at the grommet sites on one end. I contacted customer support who responded much faster than I anticipated (1 business day) asked for a couple details about my purchase and then informed me my replacements were on the way. I received the replacements within a week. With customer service like that, I won't hesitate to buy from Brandline again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We love it! It has withstood major winds this fall! No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Coe

customer_reviews.title: Useful tips
customer_reviews.text: First time assembling: plan 4+ hours, get colored electrical tape to code parts, and have at least 4 adults to help. The boxes get destroyed in shipping and there are no plastic bins big enough to put it all in. Plan on making a box for the parts. The stakes and tie rope are good if you plan on taking it down the same night, otherwise I recommend the pet corkscrew tie outs and 1" tie down straps for longer usage. Overall, does a great job for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Good product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: My quictent arrived on time and it was easy to put up. It is exactly what I thought it would be from the picture and description. I accidentally left it up during a wind storm and two of the legs and one of the door ends where damaged. I contacted the seller and got an answer by the next day. After describing what had happened the seller agreed to send me replacement parts for free! There cusomer service is excellent and the product is well built. Just don't leave it up in 35 mph wind.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: shooty product
customer_reviews.text: upon construction of canopy, the cross pieces from roof to legs were bent son the legs did not sit right, poor welds at joints, top cover torn, pipe for legs several were oval in stead of round. overall craftsmanship was a lot to be desired. I do not see were this product can be called heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M.

customer_reviews.title: Seems good enough
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems good enough, got it set up in an hour or 2.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: High quality and great shelter!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the Quictent 10x20 carport. The tent is well built. I use it for primitive camping and love it. It is very comfortable and provides excellent shelter from wind and rain. Through my own error I bent a pole and Celine at Overwhelming (the company who sold me the tent) very kindly replaced the pole for no charge. I am very happy with this purchase and the customer support from Celine and Overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Schofield Piano

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money!
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty nice tent. I've used it about 6 times and It's held up pretty well so far!
customer_reviews.author: Brucep123

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but leaks
customer_reviews.text: This tent has a lot of steps for set up and break down. We have had it up all summer even through some big storms and it’s held up well. Our only complaint is it leaks on the seams and ruined some furniture we were keeping under it temporarily.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service and repair parts are available
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 10'x20' canopy's set up end to end to cover my performance boat. It snowed 14", started to rain, then the wind came. My canopy's finally collapsed partially bending some of the tubes at the 3 ways and 4 ways, never breaking the tubes. My boat was never gouged and harmed because there were no sharp edges poking down when it failed. All of my replacement tubes I needed only cost $60.00 delivered to my door and the cover itself never ripped. For what these cover are you cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Zamzow

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Pipes came bent on the end making assembly difficult. . Grometts started to separate while assembling the top.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M Santomenno

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent and good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought two tents for a backyard get together, but one tent arrived with some poles damaged. Called customer service and they promptly sent me replacement parts in a couple of days. As others have suggested in other reviews, when you get your tent, assemble it at least one week before you need to use it so that you can get any replacements that might be needed. Once set up, tents looked really nice and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Perlaza

customer_reviews.title: Ok cheap car tent
customer_reviews.text: Goes up easy. Not for winds over 40 mph. Roof was good in the wind. But the sides need better ways of fastening to the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Damien C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product with a good price 👍
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value for the money. The only thing I can say needs some help is the assembly instructions. There's not enough details in places requiring some intuition.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to to put together
customer_reviews.text: Much better than pop up tents! Easy to assemble did it all by myself with the exception of the legs it took 3 of us to get it standing. Saved topper and side walls for a later date and made myself a tiki room!
customer_reviews.author: Ann D

customer_reviews.title: Works very well and looks nice
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to assemble taking only about 35 minutes. It looks great and it blocked out the wind perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: 10'x20' Heavy Duty Carport Gazebo Canopy
customer_reviews.text: Put it in back yard for a greenhouse. Instructions aremt s clear but assembly wasn't too. Bad. Actually build floor for it and it turned out good.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Sustained somewhat heavy rain with some wind for a good 35 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love it. We have not had any problems. We used it for a family gathering last year when it started raining (moderate) we all got under this tent and saw the other canopy around us come down this one stayed up and after the rain passed we continued the party! All my guests we impressed they have ask to borrow it for their gatherings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well for 2 or 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: This canopy held up well for 3 years in the bright, sunny Denver sun. We did replace the bungees after a year or two however, and some of the wall eyelets got torn out when there was some wind. The windows also got torn out after about a year, probably because of the wind. The top finally tore after about three years.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service was great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this carport and it was easy to install. My package contained one connector that was the wrong size. I contacted "Milka" a customer service representative for Quictents who verified the correct part, Fed Ex'd it that day and followed up with me when she received the tracking information that the part had been delivered. I appreciate the quick service and the follow up. This was the description of "Excellent Customer Service"
customer_reviews.author: Candace A. Emerson

customer_reviews.title: My car fits inside perfectly, with plenty of room!
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Roomy, sturdy, fairly easy to build. Con: No door zipper- always have to roll up large ends
customer_reviews.author: Ryguyger

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: i was going to buy the cheaper version but paid a bit more for this one as the reviews were better. needed something sturdy. so far this has done a nice job. i'm glad I spent the extra few $. good purchase,
customer_reviews.author: 1mdaman

customer_reviews.title: Great tent well made.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, easy to put up once you understand the connections. Can be done with one person but you need to assemble the top portion first, install the cover then put on the lower legs. Material is fairly thick, holds great and kept out the rain. Tent come packaged in 2 reinforced cardboard boxes which I used to store the tent when done. Quictent customer service gets back to you pretty quickly if you have issues.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon

customer_reviews.title: versatile uses, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: This carport is as described and sturdy (make sure to use heavy duty stakes and further secure the frame with lines staked to the ground!). I have used it as a temporary shelter for my hot tub -- see pic of the carport decked out with twinkle lights above the tub. The most important thing to know is that tent maker has *excellent* customer service. Always responds quickly to emails and is ready to help.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product really sturdy, had a problem with missing bungee and the customer service was great. Responded next day and shipped out stuff. On Christmas. So happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley segall

customer_reviews.title: Great tent great customer service easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I set this up completely by myself. Everything works very well. Had a DJ under the tent and lights shined through which was awesome. One pole was a little bent but it still worked. I told the company and they sent a brand new pike no questions asked. Great tent and great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: EDD

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: The tent was hard to install. Wind took it down within minutes. Thin.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: buy it
customer_reviews.text: good quality held up to a rain storm. I got sand bags for the leggs and it was perfect for our out door party
customer_reviews.author: Indnmom

customer_reviews.title: Shelter.
customer_reviews.text: Some posts do not lock together. Wind blew apart first day and many of pieces damaged and not useable.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L. Pidgeon

customer_reviews.title: a very sturdy and reliable addition
customer_reviews.text: no only did the unit serve the needs of our cars very well, but it also looks terrific and feels like a happy party all the time. I am very happy with the results, if you need a temporary or more permanent solution consider this unit as your guide.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Overflow housing
customer_reviews.text: We bought it to handle overflow housing needs at the beach this summer. Everyone wanted to stay outside in the tent! Easy set up & take down. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: It is great product
customer_reviews.text: It was to big for my yard, but it work as shade for my car
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping too!!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy up. Please order extra bunge cords. We had to buy two more packages. We used the Canopy to Camp with for a week in July and added a 110 a/c. Plus, for added insulation we added some additional tarps at the corners and used a tarp for the floor to create a bucket to eliminate cold air from escaping. It worked perfectly and we stayed cool in 109 temps. This canopy was well made and superseded our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Carson

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price. I have used it several times for backyard parties. Some grommets have ripped out due to weather but customer service has been great!!! Dealing with Green, he has made replacing some items very simple and easy. Great product! Great price! Great customer service! Great company!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful tent, however
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful tent, however, I don't care for the angle that it sits at when set up. The legs seem to bow out a little. It is a tad bit lower then the King Canopy tent we have. We are tall people and I could definitely feel the difference between the two. But it does get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Laura De Jong

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Came sooner than expected - great product. Perfectly fitting our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is simply the best. One of my helpers bent two pipes and I called them to get new ones. They emailed a schematic and had the parts to me in no time. AND it was free... Very happy with the quality!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Already ripped
customer_reviews.text: I was using this as an outdoor cover. have only had it since November of 2018...I have it in a sheltered area and it has ripped already....the roof...the sides. Trying to find out if there is some sort of garentee
customer_reviews.author: Aztwiggy

customer_reviews.title: Party tent
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy , didn’t need it till now and found that there were holes in the top Trap. And was at least 2 inches to short. Sides were also short didn’t meet up with the holes you were to connect to. Paid a lot of money that looks like a dime store product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Threat customer service
customer_reviews.text: The seller sent a new roof and ties to replace the one that got damaged. The ties are too tight and pulls the eyelids off
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: It worked great
customer_reviews.text: Did have a problem with three of the poles - they got bent the 1st time used. But they were promptly replaced and have not had a issue since.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: This is a vey easy to assemble product I had some problems due to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a vey easy to assemble product I had some problems due to weather but costumer service is fantastic they are very helpful and quick to resolve my issue I would buy it again and highly recommended it
customer_reviews.author: RAFAEL C.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Stakes are horrible. Had to get new sturdier ones. Great tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good product, wrong sidewalls
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for use at our camping trip we took this summer (Pennsic). Once I arrived and opened the packages the side walls were solid instead of having windows as ordered. Overall though the carport worked great.
customer_reviews.author: KMMyersCorrigan

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy & functional
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it could be prettier. However it is sturdy & very functional. We put it up in about 20 minutes without any complications. We screwed legs into concrete & it has held pretty steady wind (we are on a lake). I had ordered another tent that lasted 24 hours- it blew away & came apart at the joints. This structure is pretty solid. I'm taking it down after Thanksgiving but will use for outdoor festivities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware!!! This is not heavy duty. We had this up for 4 days. Had a small amount of wind and the front leg bent. Pulled it back and re-staked it and the next day both legs were broke. This product is poorly made. Don’t buy it

customer_reviews.text: We just finished setting it up, it looks great. Fast shipping, got here before we expected it. The only downfall there were not enough of the bungee ties.

product_meta.title: Quictent 10'x20' Heavy Duty Carport Gazebo Canopy Garage Car Shelter White (with Windows)
feature_bullets: ✅【WARRANTY】1. Lifetime Free Replacement for Connectors, Pegs, Ropes, Elastic ropes, etc. 2. 1 Year Free Warranty for Covers and Poles. 3. Lifetime Free Replacement for a few natural-loss poles . 4. Lifetime 50% OFF Parts Supply exceed normal 1 year warranty.
✅【Removable Sidewall】2 removable sidewalls with clear pane style window, and each window has window cover outside.
✅【HEAVY DUTY】High Quality, heavy-duty powder coated steel framework.Rust & corrosion resistant frame
✅【WATERPROOF】Reinforced 160g polyethylene roof and wall material .Waterproof, rot-resistant, and UV protected material
✅【Reinforced Packaging】Reinforced Packaging-Wooden bracket inside, will protect steel poles from shipping damages
